member.summary: Returns true if given receives marketing emails of the given .

member.name: M:CMS.Newsletters.ISubscriptionService.GetAllActiveSubscriptions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method returns all subscriptions for given contact. Contact can be subscribed directly or using contact group. Only active subscriptions are retrieved (not approved one are omitted, unsubscriptions are reflected). Does not filter out subscriptions blocked using bounces.
member.example:
Example shows how to get all newsletters the current contact is subscribed to
var newsletterIds = Service<ISubscriptionService>.Entry().GetAllActiveSubscriptions(currentContact); .Column("NewsletterID") .Distinct()
member.param: ContactId that subscriptions are returned for
member.returns: Returns with all objects that are valid for the given contact

member.name: M:CMS.Newsletters.ISubscriptionService.IsUnsubscribed(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if specified email address is unsubscribed from newsletter.
member.remarks: Takes global unsubscription into account.

member.name: M:CMS.Newsletters.ISubscriptionService.UnsubscribeFromSingleNewsletter(System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unsubscribes the email from newsletter. event is invoked after unsubscribing. Binding in the newsletter-subscription table will stay. Email will be added into the unsubscription list. Optionally, you can decide whether to send confirmation email.
member.param: ID of issue that visitor used for unsubscription. Use only when issue ID is known. When issue ID is present, number of unsubscriptions for this issue is increased
If true, confirmation email will be send after successful unsubscription
member.exception: Newsletter does not exist or email is not specified

member.name: M:CMS.Newsletters.ISubscriptionService.UnsubscribeFromAllNewsletters(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Unsubscribes the email from all newsletters. event is invoked after unsubscribing. Binding in the newsletter-subscription table will stay. Email will be added into the unsubscription list.
member.param: ID of issue that visitor used for unsubscription. Use only when issue ID is known.

member.name: M:CMS.Newsletters.SubscriptionService.GetAllActiveSubscriptions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method returns all subscriptions for given contact. Contact can be subscribed directly or using contact group. Only active subscriptions are retrieved (not approved ones are omitted, unsubscriptions are reflected). Does not filter out subscriptions blocked using bounces.
member.example:
Example shows how to get all newsletters the current contact is subscribed to
var newsletterIds = Service<ISubscriptionService>.Entry().GetAllActiveSubscriptions(currentContact); .Column("NewsletterID") .Distinct()
member.param: ContactId that subscriptions are returned for
member.returns: Returns with all objects that are valid for the given contact

member.summary: Unsubscribes the email from newsletter. event is invoked after unsubscribing. Binding in the newsletter-subscription table will stay. Email will be added into the unsubscription list. Optionally, you can decide whether to send confirmation email.

member.name: T:CMS.Newsletters.LinkTrackerService
member.summary: Tracks subscribers who clicked on a link in a newsletter issue.
member.remarks: Handles all modified links that were converted to the tracking ones via . Besides guids related to the email, every link has subscriber's email and its salted hash, which is used to validate the link. Emails sent prior to version 9 won't be logging contact activities, nor set up Online marketing context. A redirect to the original URL is sent in the response.
